comment: Defines fields exposed through the /status path of this content provider.

variables.name: CONTENT_URI
variables.comment: URI to insert/retrieve status of voicemail source.

variables.name: DIR_TYPE
variables.comment: The MIME type for a collection of voicemail source statuses.

variables.name: ITEM_TYPE
variables.comment: The MIME type for a single voicemail source status entry.

variables.name: SOURCE_PACKAGE
variables.comment:
* The package name of the voicemail source. There can only be a one entry per account * per source. *

Type: TEXT

variables.name: SOURCE_TYPE
variables.comment:
* The type of the source, which determines how to interpret source-specific states. * Typically this will be set to the same string as * {@link android.telephony.CarrierConfigManager#KEY_VVM_TYPE_STRING}. For example, * "vvm_type_omtp". * *

Type: TEXT

* * @see #CONFIGURATION_STATE * @see #DATA_CHANNEL_STATE * @see #NOTIFICATION_CHANNEL_STATE

variables.name: PHONE_ACCOUNT_COMPONENT_NAME
variables.comment:
* The {@link ComponentName} of the {@link PhoneAccount} in string form. The * {@link PhoneAccount} differentiates voicemail sources from the same package. *

Type: TEXT

variables.name: PHONE_ACCOUNT_ID
variables.comment:
* The identifier of a {@link PhoneAccount} that is unique to a specified component. The * {@link PhoneAccount} differentiates voicemail sources from the same package. *

Type: TEXT

variables.name: SETTINGS_URI
variables.comment:
* The URI to call to invoke source specific voicemail settings screen. On a user request * to setup voicemail an intent with action VIEW with this URI will be fired by the system. *

Type: TEXT

variables.name: VOICEMAIL_ACCESS_URI
variables.comment:
* The URI to call when the user requests to directly access the voicemail from the remote * server. In case of an IVR voicemail system this is typically set to the the voicemail * number specified using a tel:/ URI. *

Type: TEXT

variables.name: CONFIGURATION_STATE
CONFIGURATION_STATE_OK
variables.comment: Value of {@link #CONFIGURATION_STATE} to indicate an all OK configuration status.

variables.name: CONFIGURATION_STATE_NOT_CONFIGURED
variables.comment:
* Value of {@link #CONFIGURATION_STATE} to indicate the visual voicemail is not
         * yet configured on this device.

variables.name: CONFIGURATION_STATE_CAN_BE_CONFIGURED
variables.comment:
* Value of {@link #CONFIGURATION_STATE} to indicate the visual voicemail is not * yet configured on this device but can be configured by the user. *

This state must be used when the source has verified that the current user can be * upgraded to visual voicemail and would like to show a set up invitation message.

variables.name: CONFIGURATION_STATE_CONFIGURING
variables.comment:
* Value of {@link #CONFIGURATION_STATE} to indicate that visual voicemail still is being
         * configured.

variables.name: CONFIGURATION_STATE_FAILED
variables.comment:
* Value of {@link #CONFIGURATION_STATE} to indicate that visual voicemail has failed to
         * be configured.

variables.name: CONFIGURATION_STATE_DISABLED
variables.comment:
* Value of {@link #CONFIGURATION_STATE} to indicate that visual voicemail is disabled by
         * the user.

variables.name: DATA_CHANNEL_STATE
variables.comment:
* The data channel state of the voicemail source. This the channel through which the source * pulls voicemail data from a remote server. * *

Negative values are reserved to the source for source-specific states, see * {@link #SOURCE_TYPE} * *

Possible values: * {@link #DATA_CHANNEL_STATE_OK}, * {@link #DATA_CHANNEL_STATE_NO_CONNECTION} *

*

Type: INTEGER

variables.name: DATA_CHANNEL_STATE_OK
variables.comment: *  Value of {@link #DATA_CHANNEL_STATE} to indicate that data channel is working fine.

variables.name: DATA_CHANNEL_STATE_NO_CONNECTION
variables.comment:
*  Value of {@link #DATA_CHANNEL_STATE} to indicate that data channel failed to find a
         *  suitable network to connect to the server.

variables.name: DATA_CHANNEL_STATE_NO_CONNECTION_CELLULAR_REQUIRED
variables.comment:
*  Value of {@link #DATA_CHANNEL_STATE} to indicate that data channel failed to find a
         *  suitable network to connect to the server, and the carrier requires using cellular
         *  data network to connect to the server.

variables.name: DATA_CHANNEL_STATE_BAD_CONFIGURATION
variables.comment:
*  Value of {@link #DATA_CHANNEL_STATE} to indicate that data channel received incorrect
         *  settings or credentials to connect to the server

variables.name: DATA_CHANNEL_STATE_COMMUNICATION_ERROR
variables.comment:
*  Value of {@link #DATA_CHANNEL_STATE} to indicate that a error has occurred in the data
         *  channel while communicating with the server

variables.name: DATA_CHANNEL_STATE_SERVER_ERROR
variables.comment:
*  Value of {@link #DATA_CHANNEL_STATE} to indicate that the server reported an internal
         *  error to the data channel.

variables.name: DATA_CHANNEL_STATE_SERVER_CONNECTION_ERROR
variables.comment:
*  Value of {@link #DATA_CHANNEL_STATE} to indicate that while there is a suitable network,
         *  the data channel is unable to establish a connection with the server.

variables.name: NOTIFICATION_CHANNEL_STATE
variables.comment:
* The notification channel state of the voicemail source. This is the channel through which * the source gets notified of new voicemails on the remote server. * *

Negative values are reserved to the source for source-specific states, see * {@link #SOURCE_TYPE} * *

Possible values: * {@link #NOTIFICATION_CHANNEL_STATE_OK}, * {@link #NOTIFICATION_CHANNEL_STATE_NO_CONNECTION}, * {@link #NOTIFICATION_CHANNEL_STATE_MESSAGE_WAITING} *

*

Type: INTEGER

variables.name: NOTIFICATION_CHANNEL_STATE_OK
variables.comment:
* Value of {@link #NOTIFICATION_CHANNEL_STATE} to indicate that the notification channel is
         * working fine.

variables.name: NOTIFICATION_CHANNEL_STATE_NO_CONNECTION
variables.comment:
* Value of {@link #NOTIFICATION_CHANNEL_STATE} to indicate that the notification channel
         * connection is not working.

variables.name: NOTIFICATION_CHANNEL_STATE_MESSAGE_WAITING
variables.comment:
* Value of {@link #NOTIFICATION_CHANNEL_STATE} to indicate that there are messages waiting * on the server but the details are not known. *

Use this state when the notification can only tell that there are pending messages on * the server but no details of the sender/time etc are known.

variables.name: QUOTA_OCCUPIED
variables.comment:
* Amount of resource that is used by existing voicemail in the visual voicemail inbox, * or {@link #QUOTA_UNAVAILABLE} if the quota has never been updated before. This value is * used to inform the client the situation on the remote server. Unit is not specified. *

Type: INTEGER

variables.name: QUOTA_TOTAL
variables.comment:
* Total resource in the visual voicemail inbox that can be used, or * {@link #QUOTA_UNAVAILABLE} if server either has unlimited quota or does not provide quota * information. This value is used to inform the client the situation on the remote server. * Unit is not specified. *

Type: INTEGER

variables.name: QUOTA_UNAVAILABLE
variables.comment:
* Value for {@link #QUOTA_OCCUPIED} and {@link #QUOTA_TOTAL} to indicate that no
         * information is available.

methods.name: public static Uri buildSourceUri(String packageName)
methods.comment:
* A convenience method to build status URI specific to a source package by appending
         * {@link VoicemailContract#PARAM_KEY_SOURCE_PACKAGE} param to the base URI.
